title: Stage S14
description: Level 1 grammar practice focusing on stage-specific patterns and expressions.
learning_points: Level 1 target grammar and expressions with practical usage examples

sentences.en: Hello. Nice to meet you.
Good morning. How are you?
I'm fine, thanks. And you?
See you later. Have a good day.
Good evening. How was your day?
It was great, thank you.
Goodbye. Take care.
Hi there! Long time no see.
Good afternoon. Nice weather today.
Have a wonderful weekend!
Hello. Nice to meet you.
Good morning. How are you?
I'm fine, thanks. And you?
See you later. Have a good day.
Good evening. How was your day?
It was great, thank you.
Goodbye. Take care.
Hi there! Long time no see.
Good afternoon. Nice weather today.
Have a wonderful weekend!
He said that he was tired.

sentences.kr: 그녀는 나중에 올 거라고 저에게 말했어요. (미래→조건)
sentences.en: She told me that she would come later.
They said they were studying English.
He told her that he had finished his work.
My mother said she could help me.

sentences.kr: 선생님은 우리가 더 열심히 공부해야 한다고 말씀하셨어요.
sentences.en: The teacher told us that we must study harder.
She said that she was going to visit Paris.

sentences.kr: 그는 한 시간 동안 기다리고 있었다고 저에게 말했어요.
sentences.en: He told me he had been waiting for an hour.

sentences.kr: 그들은 다음 주에 여행할 예정이라고 말했어요.
sentences.en: They said they would be traveling next week.
She told her friend that she might be late.
He said that he was tired.
